Practising borders and backgrounds

Borders

What I learnt from this lesson was that around elements exists an invisible box. This box contains that particular of the page etc and then it has a border. Between the content box and the border is the sapce called padding. After the border, is white space that separates the whole box from the rest of the other elemets. The space is called the margin. The borders can be:

  • dotted
  • solid
  • double
  • groove
  • ridge
  • inset
  • outset

Did you know that you can also round the corners of the border by using the border radius property? Well, now you do.

Background

Another property that I learn about is the background. This can be background color or an image. If its an image, it can be repeated or tiled, it has to have a position, and it must also be correctly sized to fit in or over the box.
